### How many extra official copies of the grant do you need for use in the UK?

You'll receive an official copy of a grant of probate with your application fee.

Order extra official copies of the grant if you need to send them to different asset holders, for example, a copy for banks, insurance policies, shares and property.

Extra official copies cost £1.50 each.

What is an official copy?

It's a copy of the grant with a holographic silver seal on the front of it. A bank may ask you for a certified copy to release funds to you.

Official copies are used for assets in the UK only.
### How many extra certified copies of the grant do you need for use outside the UK?

Order extra certified copies of the grant if you need to claim the estate outside the UK.

A certified copy will have the same features as the official copy and extra information confirming the details of the certification on the back of it.

AdditionalInfo
At the time of their death was the deceased:

## Submit grant of probate applications online You must submit grant of probate applications online, unless an exemption applies. You can submit applications for letters of administration (intestacy) and letters of administration with will annexed (admon will) online when certain conditions apply. Guidance on exemptions, conditions and when application must be submitted by paper ## If inheritance tax needs to be paid If the estate has been valued and inheritance tax needs to be paid: * send the IHT400 and IHT421 form to HMRC * wait 20 working days before applying for the grant If you do not wait 20 working days to submit the probate application, we cannot verify the IHT421 details from HMRC. This will delay the grant being issued.
## Probate practitioner details

Provide the name of the probate practitioner making this application. This means the solicitor or other qualified professional (as defined by [NCPR Rule 2](https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/1987/2024/contents/made)) who will sign the [statement of truth](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/myhmcts-how-to-apply-for-probate-online/apply-for-probate-with-myhmcts#statement-of-truth), confirming that they act on behalf of the executors approving the [legal statement](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/myhmcts-how-to-apply-for-probate-online/apply-for-probate-with-myhmcts#legal-statement).

This is the legal statement and declaration for you and your client to review. If there are no changes, your client must sign the legal statement using either a digital or wet signature.

You can print the legal statement and declaration and ask your client to sign it for your own records. A photocopy of the signed statement should be submitted along with your evidence in support. 
If you are providing a notarial copy or a court sealed copy of the will please also provide a cover letter with the application indicating where the original will is and why it cannot be released.

The online service can't process cases where the deceased has any other issue, you must apply using the PA1A.

You can’t use this service if there is a beneficiary under the age of 18.

Please state the grounds for making this application and any information in support:
Bulk Scan Envelopes

#### If you have selected 'none of these' because the title and clearing is not covered by the options above, you will not be able to continue making this application online. Please apply with a [paper form](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/probate-paper-applications-for-legal-professionals).
#### By selecting 'none of these' you are confirming that the probate practitioner is making this application on behalf of other named executors who will be acting as executors.
#### By selecting 'none of these' you are confirming that the probate practitioner has a right to act as an executor, as they are named in the will.
#### By selecting 'none of these' you are confirming that the probate practitioner named in the will is not acting as an executor, and there are other named executors who will be acting as executors.
Address of firm that has succeeded to, and carried on the practice.
Address of firm named in will

If you do not have access to the original will, you will need access to a notarial or court sealed copy of the will to make an application online. If you do not have access to these documents, then you can’t apply online and must use the paper form PA1P and provide an affidavit/statement of truth and exhibits to lead to a R54 NCPR 1987 order to prove the will is lost.
##### You should only answer yes if you are appointed  in the Will specifically by your name.
##### You should only answer yes if you are acting as executor as a partner/member/shareholder/director in an appointed firm or applying as a nominee of a trust corporation
